name: ADXL362
body:
### How to use this library:
Download the zip, and makes sure it's in your <sketchbook>/libraries folder.  Rename the directory to "ADXL362".  You'll want the following directory structure in your <sketchbook>/libraries folder:
~~~
libraries/
    ADXL362/
        examples/
        ADXL362.cpp
        ADXL263.h
~~~

***

### Be Aware:
The ADXL362 is a 3.3V Device.  Please be sure that you supply 3.3V power, and 3.3V IO signals to it.  You can do this by either using logic translation, or a 3.3V Arduino.

### Tutorials
 * ["ADXL362 Arduino How-To" on Analog Devices Engineer Zone](http://ez.analog.com/docs/DOC-2222)
 * ["ADXL362 + Arduino: Using Interrupts to Implement Motion-Detected Sleep" on Analog Devices Engineer Zone](http://ez.analog.com/docs/DOC-2261)


***
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Arduino Library for ADXL362 Micropower 3-axis accelerometer
